message: The best entirely vegetarian restaurant in Vancouver is probably Foundation @ Main and 7th though it gets boring if you eat there a lot because they never change the menu. Nachos and chili are the best.
Nuba is a Lebanese psudo-fast food spot with a number of locations downtown and it has good vegetarian options.
Yeah, Nuba is good. I'll have to try Foundation ... I haven't been there yet.
If you want to go a little outside of downtown, head to Kits and visit the Naam. People rave about it, but not being a vegetarian it's not my kind of thing.
I've been to the Naam a few times and I have always felt very underwhelmed. Annapurna is very awesome if you're in Kits and want good vegetarian eats.
People do rave about the Naam but I've never thought it was all that good at all.
Check out Organic Lives on East 2nd and Quebec. Vegan and organic. Pricey but food is high quality. The Naam is overrated, plus it's filthy inside.

I've enjoyed 3G at 3424 Cambie St, it's fully vegetarian and I understand they also supply to many other restaurants in the city. Also, lots of Indian and Middle Eastern restaurants have great veggie options (East is East, Café Mumbai in the Kits area)

I love the Naam. Its not cheap, but to portions are huge, and its always open (literally). 4am Tuscan nachos for $13 split between four people is amazing! When I got there for dinner I tend to get the Thai Noodles.
